txt.en:
'The next step is to get eggs. Eggs are used to make a wash that goes over the top of the pie. This makes it cook golden brown and gives the top that delicious crunch.

'Eggs are, of course, laid by chickens. You can find them over by the animal-pens to the east.

'I'll need several eggs if I am to make all the pies I need to for the market.'
'Just enough to meet my needs. Excellent! Now only the butter is left.'
'The chickens should be used to people removing the eggs by now.'
A wash of egg-whites is needed to cover the top of the crust of the pies.
Eggs can be found near the chickens on the Northcotton Farm.\n\nRosa Brockhouse asked you to gather several eggs to help with the pie making.
Bring the eggs to Rosa Brockhouse
Rosa Brockhouse is at the Northcotton Farm.\n\nRosa Brockhouse will want to begin working with the eggs.
